0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• L-methylfolate is a medical food dispensed by prescription under medical supervision; medical foods do not have to undergo premarket review or approval by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and individual medical food products do not have to be registered with the FDA
  • Hyperhomocysteinemia; Adjunct - Schizophrenia: 7.5 to 15 mg ORALLY once daily
  • Major depressive disorder - Nutritional deficiency; Adjunct: 7.5 to 15 mg ORALLY once daily

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Hyperhomocysteinemia; Adjunct - Schizophrenia
  • Major depressive disorder - Nutritional deficiency; Adjunct

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to L-methylfolate or any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono: vitamin B12 deficiency may be masked by folate therapy; hematologic manifestations (eg, pernicious anemia) may be reversed without affecting neurologic manifestations
